meanings.definition: A person who performs or carries out a task or duty.
meanings.sent1: The diligent executants completed the project ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent2: The executants efficiently handled all the paperwork for the office.
meanings.sent3: The executants made sure the mission was accomplished with precision.
meanings.sent4: She was the executant of the plan, ensuring every detail was executed flawlessly.
meanings.sent5: The executants were like skilled conductors, orchestrating the entire operation smoothly.

meanings.definition: A person who executes a will or legal document.
meanings.sent1: The executants were responsible for carrying out the deceased's wishes as stated in the will.
meanings.sent2: The executants carefully followed the legal procedures outlined in the document.
meanings.sent3: The executants ensured that the will was executed according to the law.
meanings.sent4: As the executants of the will, they had the important task of fulfilling the deceased's requests.
meanings.sent5: The executants acted as the guardians of the deceased's final wishes, ensuring they were honored.
